com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument
Class CollectionArgs

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument.CollectionArgs

public final class CollectionArgs
extends Object

Static methods to check Collection arguments.

See ObjectArgs for an overview.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

Method Detail

checkSizeRange

@FullyTested
public static <TValue,TCollection extends Collection<TValue>> TCollection checkSizeRange(TCollection ref,
                                                                                                     int minSize,
                                                                                                     int maxSize,
                                                                                                     String argName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null and its size within specified range. Size is defined as the number of elements.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
minSize - minimum number of elements (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
maxSize - maximum number of elements (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
Returns:
the validated collection reference
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if minSize < 0
  • if maxSize < 0
  • if minSize > maxSize
  • if number of elements in ref is outside allowed range
See Also:
ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkMinSize(Collection, int, String), checkMaxSize(Collection, int, String), checkExactSize(Collection, int, String)

checkNotEmpty

@FullyTested
public static <TValue,TCollection extends Collection<TValue>> TCollection checkNotEmpty(TCollection ref,
                                                                                                    String argName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null and not empty (size >= 1). Size is defined as the number of elements.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
Returns:
the validated collection reference
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException - if number of elements in ref is zero
See Also:
checkSizeRange(Collection, int, int, String), checkMinSize(Collection, int, String)

checkElementsNotNull

@FullyTested
public static <TValue,TCollection extends Collection<TValue>> TCollection checkElementsNotNull(TCollection ref,
                                                                                                           String argName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null and each element is not null. An empty collection will pass this test.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
Returns:
the validated collection reference
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref (or any element) is null
See Also:
ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), IterableArgs.checkElementsNotNull(Iterable, String), ArrayArgs.checkElementsNotNull(Object[], String)

checkElementsUnique

@FullyTested
public static <TValue,TCollection extends Collection<TValue>> TCollection checkElementsUnique(TCollection ref,
                                                                                                          String argName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null and has unique elements. Any instance of Set is automatically assumed to have unique elements.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference. Empty collection is allowed. Also, null elements are allowed.
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
Returns:
the validated collection reference
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
See Also:
checkElementsNotNull(Collection, String)

checkNotEmptyAndElementsNotNull

@FullyTested
public static <TValue,TCollection extends Collection<TValue>> TCollection checkNotEmptyAndElementsNotNull(TCollection ref,
                                                                                                                      String argName)
This is a convenience method for checkNotEmpty(Collection, String) and checkElementsNotNull(Collection, String).

checkAccessIndex

@FullyTested
public static <T> int checkAccessIndex(Collection<T> ref,
                                                   int index,
                                                   String collectionArgName,
                                                   String indexArgName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null and an index is valid to access an element.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
index - index of element to access. Must be non-negative.
collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
Returns:
the validated index
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException - if ref is an empty collection (length zero)
IndexOutOfBoundsException -
  • if index < 0
  • if index >= ref.size()
See Also:
ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkInsertIndex(Collection, int, String, String)

checkInsertIndex

@FullyTested
public static <T> int checkInsertIndex(Collection<T> ref,
                                                   int index,
                                                   String collectionArgName,
                                                   String indexArgName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null and an index is valid to insert an element.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
index - index of element to insert. Must be non-negative.
collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
Returns:
the validated index
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IndexOutOfBoundsException -
  • if index < 0
  • if index > ref.size()
See Also:
ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkAccessIndex(Collection, int, String, String)

checkIndexAndCount

@FullyTested
public static <T> void checkIndexAndCount(Collection<T> ref,
                                                      int index,
                                                      int count,
                                                      String collectionArgName,
                                                      String indexArgName,
                                                      String countArgName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null, and an index and count are valid to access elements.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
index - index of element to access. Must be non-negative.
count - number of elements to access, starting from index. Must be non-negative.
collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
countArgName - argument name for count, e.g., "strListCount"
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if ref is an empty collection (length zero)
  • if count < 0
IndexOutOfBoundsException -
  • if index < 0
  • if index >= ref.size()
  • if index + count > ref.size()

checkFromAndToIndices

@FullyTested
public static <T> void checkFromAndToIndices(Collection<T> ref,
                                                         int fromIndex,
                                                         int toIndex,
                                                         String collectionArgName,
                                                         String fromIndexArgName,
                                                         String toIndexArgName)
Tests if a Collection reference is not null, and 'from' and 'to' indices are valid to access elements.

This test method was written for index pairs used by List.subList(int, int).

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference
fromIndex - first index of element to access. Must be non-negative.
toIndex - one greater than last index of element to access. Must be non-negative.
collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList"
fromIndexArgName - argument name for fromIndex, e.g., "strListFromIndex"
toIndexArgName - argument name for toIndex, e.g., "strListToIndex"
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException - if ref is an empty collection (length zero)
IndexOutOfBoundsException -
  • if fromIndex < 0
  • if toIndex < 0
  • if fromIndex >= ref.size()
  • if toIndex > ref.size()

checkContains

@FullyTested
public static <THaystack,TNeedle extends THaystack> TNeedle checkContains(Collection<THaystack> ref,
                                                                                      TNeedle value,
                                                                                      String collectionArgName)
Tests if a value is found in a collection of valid values.

Parameters:
ref - a collection reference of valid values
value - reference to test if found in collection of valid values
collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList"
Returns:
validated value
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if ref is an empty collection (length zero)
  • if ref does not contain value
See Also:
ArrayArgs.checkContains(Object[], Object, String)
